page.title: 19A Garage near Fletchertown.
page.content: There is a garage on the main road between Carlisle and Cockermouth,just before Mealsgate.It is called Blackwood Service Station.The man who owes it is Walton Jackson.He sells oil,petrol and parts for cars. The garage opens at 7.45 and closes at 18.00 hours.He has four pick-up trucks for going out to accidents and break-downs. Walton has owned the garage for seven years and he and his family live in a bungalow next-door to the garage.He has one daughter and two sons.His sons help him with his work in the garage and his wife and daughter often serve petrol. Walton sells second-hand cars and carries out repairs and Ministry of Transport tests.He also drives coaches for a firm in Aspatria in his spare time. His garage is the nearest one selling petrol to Fletchertown and Mealsgate.
